dublinCore.dc:title: 117 HR 6916 IH: Ending Dependence on Russian Energy Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Carter of Georgia (for himself, Mr. McKinley, Mr. Allen, Mr. Joyce of Ohio, Mr. Garcia of California, Mr. DesJarlais, and Mr. Carey) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means, and in addition to the Committees on Transportation and Infrastructure, Energy and Commerce, Natural Resources, and Foreign Affairs, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To authorize the Keystone XL Pipeline and direct the President to take certain actions relating to the importation into the United States from Russia, and the exportation from the United States, of oil and gas, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Ending Dependence on Russian Energy Act.

section.header: Keystone XL Pipeline authorization; importation and exportation of oil and gas

paragraph.text: TransCanada Keystone Pipeline, L.P., may construct, connect, operate, and maintain the pipeline facilities at the international border of the United States and Canada at Phillips County, Montana, for the import of oil from Canada to the United States described in the Presidential Permit of March 29, 2019 (84 Fed. Reg. 13101).

No Presidential permit (or similar permit) under any Executive order shall be required for the construction, connection, operation, or maintenance of the pipeline facilities described in paragraph (1).

subsection.header: Prohibition on importation from Russia of oil and gas
subsection.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the President shall prohibit the importation of any oil or natural gas originating from Russia into the customs territory of the United States (as such term is defined in General Note 2 of the Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States).

subsection.header: Reduced restrictions on exportation from United States of oil and gas
subsection.text: To the extent practicable, the President shall seek to reduce restrictions on the exportation of any oil or natural gas originating from the United States.
